questions.stem: What is the primary concept described by Newton's First Law of Motion?
options: The force applied to an object is equal to its mass times its acceleration
An object at rest will remain at rest, and an object in motion will continue to move with a constant velocity, unless acted upon by an external force
The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the force applied and inversely proportional to its mass
The velocity of an object is directly proportional to the force applied and inversely proportional to its mass
questions.rationale: Newton's First Law, also known as the Law of Inertia, states that an object will remain at rest or in uniform motion in a straight line unless acted upon by an external force.
